Text: Downloaded this show and the video it great, but there is no audio.  How do I get both audio and video files to play all at once.  Please go into detail.

The audio is VBR, which some media players have trouble with. The best suggestion I can give is use a media player which supports it such as VLC. http://www.videolan.org/. Sorry for the inconvenience, I didn't know about the issue until a lot of people started sending me messages about it, I'll do better next time.

Would this be a good time to point out the ACTUAL version of season 1 is FOUR dvd's?

I highly doubt the quality of this.

The video is obviously downsampled a lot to fit on about a quarter of its original size, but I think it's still much better quality here than on e.g. a TV rip of comparable size as the source is vastly better.

Maybe you should download the torrent and see the quality for yourself instead of posting useless FUD about your "doubts"? Each episode is compressed to about 330MB, only slightly less than a typical TV rip.

It's stupid...why rip it in lame vbr, when it can not be played in standalone players?! What's wrong with cbr mp3, or leaving it ac-3?
I should have read the nfo before downloading. Don't bother with this one, if you plan on watching it on your dvd/divx player!
I downloaded this and it has no audio!

vbr audio is useless. ac3 is just fine. I wonder why the author chose what that method. ac3 passthrough sounds better anyway and plays on more devices. Also, why isn't there an HD version of season one floating around anywhere? I've found HD for the miniseries, season 2 and season 3. Why not season one? BOO! :(

Ripping a DVD to a universal format is such a simple process, yet time after time we find these horrible torrents that ONLY play in VLC because the ripper's knowledge is limited to clicking all the video/audio options and then wielding a list of dumb stats in the sad belief that everyone will think he's a fucking genius.
However, if you've spent days downloading this and want to stream it through your PS3, IO Data Link or whatever to your TV, it's certainly worth the effort to re-encode them. The quality is pretty good once you correct the hash the ripper made of them.

Haven't downloaded this yet, but thanks in advance for squeezing it in one dvd and cutting the needless "previously on..." sequences.

Also all or most home DVD players with DixX codec will not play these XviD avi files.

The quality is excellent, both video and audio.  It plays fine for me on a stock Ubuntu install.  No VLC needed.

To the complainers, don't look a gift horse in the mouth - transcode it yourself.  There's enough quality here to give decent results after transcoding to whatever format you need.

I just finished this season, and am now watching a more conventionally-encoded rip of season 2.  The drop in quality compared to this torrent, especially for the audio, is very, very noticeable.

PS: Thanks again to the ripped for cutting out the superfluous recap segments at the beginning of each episode!  Don't let the whiners get to you!
